vision.notes: Sensory capabilities of Gadilinidae are largely unstudied. Vision presence or absence is currently unknown.

chemoreception.notes: As mollusks, Gadilinidae likely rely on chemoreception to detect food and other environmental cues. This is inferred from other molluscan classes.

mechanoreception.notes: Scaphopods, including Gadilinidae, likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing their environment, burrowing and detecting prey. This is inferred from the lifestyles of similar mollusks.
